fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Go to the create issue form.
# Click the label "Summary".
# Click the label "Issue Type".

Result: The summary field is focued when clicking its label but the issue type field is not. There are several fields that are focused by clicking their labels, and several fields that are not.
fields.summary: Clicking the label beside some fields does not focus those field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28111].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Restore JIRA5.0_QAData.zip
# Invoke the quick edit dialog for any issue.
# Press save.

*Result:* There are errors in two fields. The second one ("<input type="text" AUTOFOCUS onfocus=document.write(12*12)>") is autofocused.

*Expected result:* The first one ("Big-Project-Picker") should be autofocused.
fields.summary: Quick Edit: The second of two errors is focussed, not the first
Focus after deleting a fixVersion is wrong

fields.description:
1. Use a JIRA OnDemand instance, with GApps enabled.
2. Edit an issue, click on 'Update' button, without making any changes.
3. Activity Tab registers event as:
!google_docs.png!

Activity Streams seem to have registered an action which says "Google Docs were removed"

Video Capture: http://screencast.com/t/euBbioZjR
fields.summary: In JIRA OnDemand, updating an issue without making any change, records it as 'Removing Google Documents'

fields.description: See picture
fields.summary: Overlapping dialogs

fields.description:
1) Start up a JOD instance with 5.0
2a) Using webdav, upload the attached data file to https://<instance>.jira-dev.com/webdav
2b) Alternatively, scp the file to /data/jirastudio/webdav and chmod 666 it.
3) As an admin, use the customer-facing JIRA Importer UI tool to import the data file.
4) While the import is in progress, in another tab or browser, make requests to the instance until you start getting JavaScript errors in the second tab.

Once it's complete, the JIRA UI is quite broken. It's looking like the JIRA bundled plugins (dashboards, AJS, etc) are missing. In some cases the UI looks OK but none of the JavaScript works.

Here's what the dashboard looks like in some cases:
!JIRADashboard.png!

There are lots of JavaScript errors:
{noformat}
SCRIPT5009: 'AJS' is undefined 
batch.js, line 1 character 1
SCRIPT5009: 'AJS' is undefined 
batch.js?cache=false, line 1 character 2
SCRIPT438: Object doesn't support property or method '$' 
batch.js, line 3 character 13
SCRIPT5007: Unable to get value of the property 'namespace': object is null or undefined 
batch.js, line 1 character 14
SCRIPT5009: 'jQuery' is undefined 
batch.js, line 1 character 1
SCRIPT5009: 'jQuery' is undefined 
com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard:dashboard.js, line 1 character 25
SCRIPT5009: 'Calendar' is undefined 
jira.webresources:calendar-en.js, line 1 character 1
SCRIPT438: Object doesn't support property or method '$' 
Dashboard.jspa, line 112 character 9
SCRIPT5007: Unable to get value of the property 'DashboardManager': object is null or undefined 
Dashboard.jspa, line 387 character 9
SCRIPT438: Object doesn't support property or method 'toInit' 
contentnamesearch.js, line 3 character 5
SCRIPT438: Object doesn't support property or method 'toInit' 
split_button.js, line 5 character 1
SCRIPT438: Object doesn't support property or method 'toInit' 
userstatus.js, line 5 character 1
SCRIPT5009: 'jQuery' is undefined 
safe-ajax.js, line 5 character 5
{noformat}

* Reproduces in both JIRA-only mode and full JIRA Studio
* Reproduces with GApps and non-GApps
* Does not reproduce with the same import file in BTF
* Happened independently for both Panna and me on different instances.

Restarting JIRA fixes it again - problems with the plugin system?
fields.summary: The JIRA UI is broken after hitting JIRA during an import in OnDemand
Accessing the error page during a Studio import corrupts batching of AUI resources

fields.description:
Configuration as in screenshot - for issue types Bug & New Feature I have a screen different than default (less fields). In Quick Create when I change issue types for this project the fields get updated accordingly (with the option 'All' fields set). Changing issue type in Quick Edit does not update the fields according to the associated screen.

One of the ways in which this can be quite problematic is when changing a tasks issue type to epic in JIRA Agile via the edit screen. In the default create/edit screen for epics an Epic Name is required, but this bug allows you to actually edit an issue, change it's type to an epic, without providing an epic name. Consequently this creates an unlabelled epic
fields.summary: Quick Edit - Fields are not refreshed when issue type changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28104].
  {panel}

It seems that REST requests require time codes as the following for example:
{code}
2012-05-05T01:01:01.123+1000
{code}
The following time codes do not work:
{code}
2012-05-05T01:01:01
2012-05-05T01:01:01Z
2012-05-05T01:01:01+1000
2012-05-05T01:01:01.123
2012-05-05T01:01:01.123Z
{code}

The failed response headers:
{code}
Request URL:http://localhost:5003/rest/api/2/issue/HSP-2/worklog
Request Method:POST
Status Code:500 Internal Server Error
Request Headersview source
Accept:*/*
Accept-Charset:ISO-8859-1,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.3
Accept-Encoding:gzip,deflate,sdch
Accept-Language:en-US,en;q=0.8,en-AU;q=0.6
Connection:keep-alive
Content-Length:59
Content-Type:application/json
Cookie:remember=localadmin:7:6ed34746f5098e7289fbe02c9daad8db; crucibleprefs1="D%3D1331875449435"; jira.conglomerate.cookie=; doc-sidebar=283px; confluence.browse.space.cookie=space-blogposts; AJS.conglomerate.cookie="|upm.tab=manage"; gh.i=%7B%7D; JSESSIONID=287BF7E26194C9779CFD98C334C6F0A7; atlassian.xsrf.token=AG87-S37R-QM8W-6VWE|cf47098c9c82f06c08660286b925763668dd762a|lin; __utma=1.1602233020.1335846110.1336345641.1336351466.5; __utmc=1; __utmz=1.1335846110.1.1.utmcsr=(direct)|utmccn=(direct)|utmcmd=(none)
Host:localhost:5003
Origin:chrome-extension://cokgbflfommojglbmbpenpphppikmonn
User-Agent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/535.19 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/18.0.1025.168 Safari/535.19
Request Payload
{"started": "2012-05-05T01:01:01+1000", "timeSpent": "5m"}
Response Headersview source
Cache-Control:no-cache, no-store, no-transform
Connection:close
Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8
Date:Mon, 07 May 2012 01:22:50 GMT
Server:Apache-Coyote/1.1
Transfer-Encoding:chunked
X-AREQUESTID:682x95x1
X-ASESSIONID:7gl0gd
X-AUSERNAME:test
X-Seraph-LoginReason:OK
{code}

The failed response:
{code}
{"errorMessages":["Internal server error"],"errors":{}}
{code}

An internal server error here doesn't help with understanding that the timecode is incorrect. This should return a more descriptive error, or support the ISO 8601 standard.

h3. To reproduce:
Use the Google Chrome REST Console, enter request URI, eg:
{code}
http://localhost:5003/rest/api/2/issue/HSP-2/worklog
{code}
Request method: POST
Content-Type: application/JSON
RAW body, eg:
{code}
{"started": "2012-05-05T01:01:01+1000", "timeSpent": "5m"}
{code}
fields.summary: Rest GET request to use standard time formatting or provide useful error messages

fields.description:
As of 4.4.4, the Project Key Pattern is now set within the project keys, as in [Configuring Project Keys|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Configuring+Project+Keys]. As it is no longer set it {{jira-application.properties}}, the installer does not let the user know that they need to make the changes in the [Advanced Settings|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Configuring+JIRA+Options#ConfiguringJIRAOptions-advanced] and the value is not migrated across to the database during an upgrade to that version.

If the user has set a custom {{jira.projectkey.pattern}}, that value will not be migrated to the database when upgrading to JIRA 4.4.4.

h5. Workaround

Update the pattern in [Advanced Settings|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Configuring+JIRA+Options#ConfiguringJIRAOptions-advanced].
fields.summary: jira.projectkey.pattern is not recognised or migrated after upgrade to 4.4.4
"noformat" block goes off the right of the screen, overlapping the drag and drop attach area
OauthApplinksServlet Open Redirect
ConsumerConfigurationServlet Open Redirect
AddConsumerReciprocalServlet Open Redirect

fields.description:
Currently JIRA reindexing is kicked off right after JIRA upgrades and before plugin upgrades. As a consequence the plugin upgrades run in parallel together with the JIRA reindexing.

Either wait for JIRA to be reindexed before running the plugin upgrades or the other way around.
fields.summary: Synchronise JIRA upgrade reindexing with plugin upgrades
Persian language
Bug

fields.description:
In JIRA version 4.4.4 bundling UPM 1.4.1 - the UPM will ask users to upgrade to incompatible JIRA 5.x plugins. 

For example please see screenshot where the UPM is asking the user to install GreenHopper 5.9.x that will not work with JIRA 4.4.4


{panel:title=Workaround| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=#FFFFCE} 
As a workaround for this please perform the following *note it will require a JIRA restart*:
* Go to [this page|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin] and download the UPM .jar file for UPM 2.2
* Put that .jar into the folder [JIRA_HOME]/plugins/installed-plugins if there already is a UPM .jar in that folder remove it first.
* Restart JIRA, the new UPM should be in place.

{panel}
fields.summary: JIRA 4.4.4 UPM 1.4.1 asks users to upgrade to incompatible JIRA 5.x plugins

fields.description:
{panel}
h4. +Original Description+
I have Jira 4.4.4 and Jira 5.0.2 instances, both hooked up to LDAP.  I’m trying to find issues where the assignee was a certain person but has now changed.  For the sake of example, let’s call this user John Smith.

I’m using LDAP, so the full name looks like “Smith, John” and the username looks like “jsmith”.

Both of these queries work:
	
    assignee = "Smith, John"

and

    assignee = jsmith

But if I try

    assignee was jsmith

I get the error

    The value 'jsmith' does not exist for the field 'assignee'.

And if I try

    assignee was "Smith, John"

I get no results!

The same things happen with “changed from” instead of “was”.

I thought it might be the comma messing things up, but the same things happen when I use the pair “Jira Admin” and “admin”.

I found two similar bugs in the database: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-26953 and https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27717 , but they don’t mention anything about the username not existing error.  That’s why I’m filing a new bug.  I thought it might be relevant that I’m using LDAP.
{panel}

h4. +New findings in JIRA 6.3.8+
# Regarding the *username*:
#* if searched by someone with Browse Users global permission, results are returned correctly
#* if searched by someone *without* Browse Users global permission, the following error is thrown:
!username.png|thumbnail!
(i) This has been discussed in some of the comments below and one workaround is to grant the Browse Users global permission to those who need to perform searches with {{assignee was <username>}} frequently
# Regarding the *fullname*:
#* when a new user is created, searching with {{assignee was <fullname>}} is *not* possible, resulting in this error (not depending on Browse Users global permission):
!fullname.png|thumbnail!
#* however, after assigning an issue to this user, then searching with {{assignee was <fullname>}} is *possible* (not depending on Browse Users global permission)

h4. +Suggestion+
* When a search with username fails, a more meaningful message should be displayed instead of saying that the user does not exist
* Sometimes, a user without Browse User global permission can still search with username, but this is not easily reproducible
(!) this may involve some username change or assignee change which can't be reproduced consistently
fields.summary: Assignee history (WAS / CHANGED FROM) not searchable by either full name or user name when searching anonymously

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
In JIRA 5.0.3's Worklow Designer, JIRA text labels doesn't translate to German and Russian. The problem is not reproducible in French.

In German, labels appear in its original value:

!German.jpg!

This issue happens even though the properties inside {{i18n_de_DE.properties}} are correct.

{noformat}
workflow.designer.statuses=Status
workflow.designer.workflow.name.required=Name des Arbeitsablaufs ist erforderlich.
{noformat}

In Russian, labels are disorganised:

!Russian.jpg!
fields.summary: JIRA Text Labels Does Not Translate to German and Russian in Workflow Designer

fields.description:
After setting the "User mail Visibility" to *Hidden* in the "General Configuration", the autocomplete does not render any user when using the @Mention functionality in comment.  Only the first letter is shown in the auto-complete dropdown with the message "no matching users found".

As a workaround solution in JIRA 5, you can set the user email visible for all or visible for login users.
fields.summary: @Mention failed if the user mail visibility is set to Hidden

fields.description:
When bulk changing issues to change the Assignee to 'Automatic', the issues will be assigned to Project Lead instead of Component Lead for the issues that have components specified to it. Points to be noted is that the Component Leads are the Default Assignee for the components, and the issues are associated to the components. 

Steps to reproduce the behavior are:
- Create a sample project
- Create a couple of components, specify the Component Lead and set the Default Assignee to Component Lead
- Create a few sample issue, and have the issues associated to at least one component. Have the issue assigned to some user, other than the Component Lead
- Go to Issue Navigator and search for the issues, bulk change the issues edit the issue, and specify the Assignee to 'Automatic'
- The issues will be assigned to Project Lead, instead of the Component Lead
- If we go to the issues individually and edit the issue, set the Assignee to 'Automatic', the issue will be assigned to Component Lead

This behavior only occurs in JIRA 4.4 and above. Prior to JIRA 4.4 (4.3 and below), bulk changing the issues to change the Assignee will have the issues assigned to Component Lead
fields.summary: Bulk changing issues doesn't assign issues to Component Lead when specifying the Assignee to 'Automatic'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28076].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a custom field Cascading Select
# Add the options into it
# Create an issue
# Select 'NONE' for the Cascading Select custom field
The issue successfully created without exception
# Edit the same issue and select 'NONE' for the Cascading Select custom field again
The following error appear and the update fail:
{noformat}
2012-05-04 18:18:58,904 http-8503-6 ERROR kahloun.foong 1098x176x1 2zrt38 127.0.0.1 /secure/QuickEditIssue.jspa [jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService] Exception occurred editing issue: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.CascadingSelectCFType.getChangelogValue(CascadingSelectCFType.java:390)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.CascadingSelectCFType.getChangelogValue(CascadingSelectCFType.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.getChangelogValue(CustomFieldImpl.java:378)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.updateValue(CustomFieldImpl.java:418)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.updateValue(CustomFieldImpl.java:399)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.updateFieldValues(DefaultIssueManager.java:589)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.updateIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.update(DefaultIssueService.java:272)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.update(DefaultIssueService.java:246)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
{noformat}

*Workaround*
# Shutdown JIRA
# Backup and modify the file {{<jira-install>\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\templates\plugins\fields\edit\edit-cascadingselect.vm}} from
{noformat}
<select class="select cascadingselect-parent" id="${customField.id}" name="${customField.id}">
        <option class="default-option" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.pleaseselect")</option>
        <option class="default-option" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
        #foreach ($option in $configs.options.rootOptions)
            #if(!$option.disabled || $option.disabled == false || ($selectedParent && $selectedParent == $option.optionId.toString()))
                <option class="option-group-$option.optionId" value="$option.optionId"#if ($selectedParent && $selectedParent == $option.optionId.toString()) selected="selected"#end>$cfValueEncoder.encodeForHtml($option.value)</option>
            #end
        #end
    </select>
    <select class="select cascadingselect-child" id="${customField.id}:1" name="${customField.id}:1">
        <option class="default-option" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.pleaseselect")</option>
        <option class="default-option" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
        #foreach ($parentOption in $configs.options.rootOptions)
            <option class="option-group-$parentOption.optionId" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.pleaseselect")</option>
            <option class="option-group-$parentOption.optionId" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
{noformat}
to
{noformat}
<select class="select cascadingselect-parent" id="${customField.id}" name="${customField.id}">
        <option class="default-option" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
        <!-- <option class="default-option" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option> -->
        #foreach ($option in $configs.options.rootOptions)
            #if(!$option.disabled || $option.disabled == false || ($selectedParent && $selectedParent == $option.optionId.toString()))
                <option class="option-group-$option.optionId" value="$option.optionId"#if ($selectedParent && $selectedParent == $option.optionId.toString()) selected="selected"#end>$cfValueEncoder.encodeForHtml($option.value)</option>
            #end
        #end
    </select>
    <select class="select cascadingselect-child" id="${customField.id}:1" name="${customField.id}:1">
        <option class="default-option" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
        <!-- <option class="default-option" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option> -->
        #foreach ($parentOption in $configs.options.rootOptions)
            <option class="option-group-$parentOption.optionId" value="">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option>
            <!-- <option class="option-group-$parentOption.optionId" value="-1">$i18n.getText("common.words.none")</option> -->
{noformat}
# Restart JIRA
This modification will remove the 'Please select' in the option and replace it with the word 'None'
fields.summary: NullPointerException selecting NONE for Cascading Select Field
Need ability to automatically add users to Watch list based on Component

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28074].
  {panel}

In JIRA 5.0, A ticket / issue that contains sub-tasks will display the progress of all the sub-tasks
- Estimation
- Progress

However, this display is not applied for linked issues. It is not a feature that is implemented for issue links section since it only displays issue linking description and which issue it is linked to.

A customer requested for this feature to be implemented.
fields.summary: Displaying the estimation of linked issues's progress
Import Results action / jsp is susceptible to XSRF

fields.description:
The administration screen which facilitates the addition of new custom field options is vulnerable to csrf, as it does not check that the atl_token submitted is in fact legitimate for the user submitting it (you can put in any value for the token field).   

To access this screen you can go to a url similar to the following ( it is linked off the issue custom fields administration page (/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa) ):

http://$host/secure/admin/EditCustomFieldOptions!default.jspa?fieldConfigSchemeId=10300&fieldConfigId=10300&customFieldId=10200&returnUrl=ConfigureCustomField!default.jspa%3FcustomFieldId%3D10200
fields.summary: CSRF in the "configure custom field"  Multi Checkboxes add new custom field option screen
Revert the way edits pages print

fields.description:
If I create a custom field with custom Severity levels, it seems that they are ordered incorrectly when sorting in the Issue Navigator.

This is how they are ordered in the DB:

| 0 | Critical |
| 1 | Very High |
| 2 | High |
| 3 | Medium |
| 4 | Low |
| 5 | Trivial |

But when ordering by the field in the issue navigator the "Very High" level is ranked the lowest.

Very similar to this closed bug:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-26726
fields.summary: Incorrect severity sort order of custom fields

fields.description:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+Delete+a+Project+due+to+java.lang.NullPointerException
but I couldn't find a bug related to that page so I create this one.

I got this error at a customer site, not using Crowd, using an AD User Directory. Project roles had been modified over a period of weeks. Attempting to delete a project produced the stacktrace

fields.description:
I've started a fresh JIRA 4.4.4 instance and when I go to _Administration > Plugins > Upgrade_ I have option to upgrade the _JIRA FishEye Plugin_ from the version 3.4.6 to the version 5.0.4.1.

The problem is: this version 5.0.4.1 is for JIRA 5.0 - 5.0.3.
fields.summary: UPM is upgrading to the wrong plugin version

fields.description:
java.lang.NullPointerException exception when creating an issue.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create user with user name "johndoe" and full name "Jhon Doe" (sic)
2. Assign johndoe 'user' and 'developer' project roles to Project A.
3. Edit johndoe's Full Name to the corrected "John Doe"
4. Open up the create issue form for Project A
5. While creating the issue assign it to "johndoe" user.  Field is auto-populated with the original (misspelled) full name "Jhon Doe"
6. Click "Create".  Null pointer exception.

The issue is created, despite the null pointer exception, but the UI doesn't reflect this. In my case, I wound up creating the issue 4x because it didn't appear to be working.

Looks like whatever lookup table the user dropdown field is using in the Create Issue form is not being refreshed when changes are made to user's who are manually assigned project roles. Just a guess.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when creating an issue assigned to a renamed user.
JS error on speakeasy extensions page
REST endpoint in JIRA to retrieve issues based on remote issue data.
The ability to query remote link data via JQL
User group association

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.summary: Inconsistant capitalisation in the keyboard shortcuts help menu i.e. "?"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Links are not usable in the Printable View if the Issue Browser. This is by design.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Steps to reproduce:
# Go to Your JIRA Site.
# Create a filter and display the results
# Click the *Views* > *Printable View* (Or *Export* > *Printable*)  option
# Try to click on a link.

h3. Expected Results
The Links should open when clicked or have the UI appearance/behave as links.

h3. Actual Results
The Links can not be clicked due to a missing JavaScript that will handle this behaviour, however they 'appear' to be clickable

h3. Notes
This is currently by design, a limitation of the printable view as the printable view is designed for printing a report of searched issues. 

h3. Workaround 
Right clicking the links and opening them in a new tab, you can workaround this issue.
fields.summary: Printable View links are not clickable in filter results
noformat in description scrolls of the screen, while it properly has scroll bars in comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28054].
  {panel}

Whilst working on JRADEV-10913 I encountered a bug which I could reproduce only in IE9 (didn't try IE8 yet).

Attached is a dataset which is based on JIRA5.0_QAData.zip in which I created a simple qa-like workflow to help me reproduce the the bug in JRADEV-10913. This, and my lack of experience in setting up workflows, screens, etc, may well be the cause of the issue. However this sort of error should preferably not occur due to user error.

Steps to reproduce:

In IE9: 
- Restore attached data
- Create an issue in the QA project
- Transition the newly created issue to "In Progress" by clicking Workflow -> Start Progress
- Click "QA Time"
- Enter a tester name and submit the form.
-- Please note that sometimes the transition buttons under the Ops Bar do not update. If this occurs then it's certain that there's going to be an SQL error. In this case click Workflows -> Back to In Development
- If no error occurs transition "Back to Development"
- Repeat the above steps alternating tester value from admin to fred and back until an SQL error is displayed as follows:

{quote}
Could not move to history step for #12694: root cause: while inserting: [GenericEntity:OSHistoryStep][id,13052][caller,admin][startDate,2012-04-17 16:19:08.781][status,Not Done][owner,][finishDate,2012-04-17 16:19:32.143][actionId,791][stepId,3][dueDate,null][entryId,12694] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO PUBLIC.OS_HISTORYSTEP (ID, ENTRY_ID, STEP_ID, ACTION_ID, OWNER, START_DATE, DUE_DATE, FINISH_DATE, STATUS, CALLER) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Unique constraint violation: SYS_IDX_107 in statement [INSERT INTO PUBLIC.OS_HISTORYSTEP (ID, ENTRY_ID, STEP_ID, ACTION_ID, OWNER, START_DATE, DUE_DATE, FINISH_DATE, STATUS, CALLER) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)]))
{quote}
fields.summary: Cannot transition workflow in IE9. SQL error and data dodginess results.
Improve Restoring Data Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28051].
  {panel}

# As an admin, go to the priorities admin page, edit one of the default priorities, and change the description *but not the name*
# Create a new issue, do not submit yet
# In the field to choose the priority, click the help icon. It pops up a window with descriptions for each priority
# *Note that the customised description is not displayed, the default text is*
# Go back and change the name (you can just add a period or apostrophe to the end)
# *Now the customised description _is_ displayed*

*Workaround*: create a "translation" for each out-of-the-box priority in the default language. This causes the help page to reflect the translation rather than the base description.
fields.summary: Customised priority description is not displayed in the priority help window if the priority name is not customised

fields.description:
Hello,

i configured jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields to show components and use quickcreationform-vertical.vm.
The component-field gets shown, but i can not edit the field nor can i enter something manually.

thanks,
michael
fields.summary: jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields add components didn't work properly

fields.description:
In JIRA OnDemand, it is not possible to configure JIRA to read file system messages from a subdirectory within the 'import/mail' subdirectory of the JIRA Home Directory.

The 'Folder Name' field on the 'Mail Handler' dialog box is used for this purpose.

Hence, at least this field (and most probably the 'Local Files' option in the 'Server' field too), should not be present on the 'Mail Handler' dialog box.
fields.summary: When configuring a Mail Handler in JIRA OnDemand, the 'Local Files' option in the 'Server' field (and the 'Folder Name' field itself) in the 'Mail Handler' dialog box should not be available.

fields.description: I installed JIRA 5.0.3 and Confluence 4.2.1. Connected the two, copied the accounts, and then tried to create an issue in Confluence. It was not able to create an issue because there was no reporter. In the form on Confluence there is no reporter field. I made the reporter field not required in JIRA and then I was able to create an issue. No reporter was assigned to it. This is not an issue with JIRA 5.0.2 (tested by David Chan).
fields.summary: Reporter not automatically assigned for issues created via CreateIssueDetails action

fields.description: Look at the two screenshots - the first has both Original and Remaining Estimate. But after creating an issue and continuing on, only the Original Estimate field is shown.
fields.summary: Quick Create shows 'Time Tracking' field inconsistently

fields.description:
In JIRA 5.0.x a function was added for JIRA to easily create a Confluence page link, as seen here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues#LinkingIssues-CreatingalinktoaConfluencepage

The problem is that this does not work with earlier versions of Confluence (pre Confluence 4.x).

Steps to reproduce:
* Setup a fresh instance of JIRA 5.x and Confluence 3.5.x
* Setup application links between the 2 instances
** remember to enable remote API
* Create a JIRA issue
* Select *More Actions > Link > Confluence Page*
* Notice that JIRA does not recognize the Confluence pages
* No errors are shown in logs
* See screenshots below

I also ran the same test with Confluence 4.2 and was able to link to Confluence pages with no problems.
fields.summary: Linking Issues to Confluence Pages fail for JIRA 5.0+ and Confluence 3.5.x

fields.description:
# Create an 'JIRA Admin' only user (i.e. a user with JIRA Administrators permission but not JIRA System Administrators permission)
# Make sure you have websudo permission already by visiting an admin page. If you don't do this you will hit JRA-27819.
# Goto a dashboard with the admin gadget.
# (BUG) Click on the "Install GH" or "Install Bon" link. You will end up with a horrible dialog with 401 error.

!error.png!

As only JIRA System Administrators have permissions to install plugins, I would assume that these links should not be visible admins without this permission.
fields.summary: GH and BON evaluations links from the admin gadget are shown to non system admins

fields.description:
The word "schedules" is misspelled  at the end of the last paragraph.

"Also, please refer to this document which explains the way Atlassian shcedules new features." 

should be

"Also, please refer to this document which explains the way Atlassian schedules new features."
fields.summary: Typographical error in "Using JIRA to Manage reusable modules" article/documentation

fields.description:
When you create an Application Link between JIRA and FishEye (example), you have a new entry in the table _oauthconsumer_ related to this Application Link, where you can find the keys for this connection.

But when you remove this Application Link, this entry stays in the Database. Additionally, if you create another Application Link between this two instances again, it will use the same keys from before. It don't change even the _created_ field.

This can be considerated a security flaw in the way application links handle authentication. If you migrate some JIRA project from one instance to another, you will be able to receive streams (activity stream) from the other instance, because you have this keys in the DB, even if you didn't set up an Application Link.
fields.summary: Remove an Application link doesn't remove the Application Consumer ID
Issue list functionality - subtasks and technical task list offset
Add a bold word in the summary
Be able to clone watchers
Favorite projects

fields.description:
* Open the _Edit Profile_ dialog
* Focus the _Update_ button (e.g. by tab)
* Press up and down keys
* *Bug:* the page in the background gets scrolled (see screenshot)
fields.summary: Focusing the update button in the Edit Profile dialog and pressing up and down scrolls the page

fields.description:
* Goto user's profile
* Edit Details
* Don't change username of email address
* Click _Update_
* *Bug:* the details page claims, that the details have been updated

It seems, that there is already some change-detection contained in the dialog: it doesn't complain about a wrong password in case neither username nor email address are modified.

I would expect this message only, when the properties are actually changed.
fields.summary: Updating user's details in Edit Profile dialog without actually changing them results in annoying details updated message
update Tempo in JOD to version 7.0.3.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28032].
  {panel}

When some one migrates workflows prior to JIRA 4.4 there are no change history items written for changing statues and so on.

This means that the Change History index does NOT reflect the correct information.

GreenHopper recently encounted this bug

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4849

While fixed in post 4.4 code, it does not help for data that was migrated prior to 4.4.

Talking to [~jwinters] about this he mentioned that JIRA could have a upgrade tasks / integrity check that fixed up the change history and hence the index.
fields.summary: Upgrade task / integrity check needed for missing change history items during workflow migration

fields.description:
Presenting language choices in the current language adds unnecessary barriers to the user choosing their preferred language. It reduces what should be a recognition task to a guessing game.

!https://img.skitch.com/20120501-pfneykumjnen61r3gbw3nakky.png!
!https://img.skitch.com/20120501-g5198ygu8dxy979a9ib9kqwamg.png!

Each language choice should be written in the language it represents.

!https://img.skitch.com/20120501-ctryg2td79xq9w9nxtpc57s9i3.png!
fields.summary: Always display language choices as written in their own language
New dashboard layout
Update Flowdock to 1.50.5 in onDemand
Ability to bulk change the parent of a sub-task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28027].
  {panel}

If you [look at the documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues#LinkingIssues-Creatingalinktoanotherissue] there are only three ways to link issues:

# Type in the project key itself. That requires the user to sit there memorising project keys. Not something that anybody really wants to do.
# Select an item from their JIRA browsing history. This is useful, but you have to have visited the item before, sometimes you know of an item that is not in your history. For example, when a fellow developer leans over and tells you to add issue X.
# Select an item from a saved filter. This is good too but restricted in scope.

I would like to suggest that when you type text in the initial search box it literally searches JIRA for items that match that text; not only looks through your history. It would be more in keeping with customer expectations.
fields.summary: Allow more general search in "Link Issue" page.
Before being able to create an issue it should search for previous issues
Support image orientation detection in uploads

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28023].
  {panel}

JIRA JQL is not integrated with other Atlassian products database, like Crucible or Bamboo. You are not allowed to search something like:

# What issues don't have a code review?
You can't determine which JIRA issues don't have a code review, there is not a JQL query for it, nothing like: "reviewOfIssue()" which might return the linked review list or "empty".
# What Bamboo builds have a certain JIRA issue linked to them?
In the JIRA dashboard, you can't setup a filter or JQL query that shows which JIRAs are linked to a build (or not).

The JQL from JIRA needs to be more "global".
fields.summary: JQL more integrated
Calling getAttachments() on blank issue throws NPE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28020].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Add a Date Time Picker custom field and associate it with the Create Issue Screen
 # Change your language to German
 # Create an issue
 # Click on the date picker for Due Date
 # Try to change to next month by hovering on the next month button
 # The description of the button will show at the bottom of the date picker: Nächst. Monat (Festhalten für Schnellauswahl)
 # The text is too long that the date picker resize
 # When it resize to be longer, my mouse cursor is not hovering the button anymore so the description text change and the date picker resize to be smaller again.
 # This create a loop resize effect
 # Click on the date time picker for the custom field created
 # Similar observation encountered when attempt to click on the minute area

*Workaround*
 (!) This workaround is applied to JIRA Server only. JIRA Cloud does not support the customisation of source files. See [Restricted functions in JIRA Cloud applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/restricted-functions-in-jira-cloud-applications-776636921.html].
 # Shutdown JIRA
 # Edit {{<jira-install>\atlassian-jira\includes\lib\calendar\lang\calendar-de-min.js}} so that it will have a shorter description text
 # Restart JIRA

*JIRA Cloud Workaround*

Use English language pack instead of German.

*Additional Information*
* This behaviour is consistent throughout the Chrome and Internet Explorer, but Firefox seems to be not affected by this, it is able to handle the long description by creating a new line.

* For JIRA Cloud, tested and verified that this is affecting on Firefox.
fields.summary: Date Picker and Date Time Picker unusable in German language

fields.description:
Using my tablet to attempt to create an issue, I hit the "Create Issue" button which pops up the creation overlay.  When using either the stock Android browser, or Dolphin HD browsers, attempts to interact with the controls on the overlay end up going through to the controls on the original page.  ie, if I have a bug page open, the Issue Type dropdown is approximately over the workflow buttons, and trying to click the issue type ends up highlighting the button underneath.
Using Firefox on my tablet works as expected.
fields.summary: Create Issue popup screen is unusable on Android and Dolphin browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28018].
  {panel}

Please improve the ability to require resources in the gadget XML. Here are a few ideas:

1. #requireResourcesForContext("some.context") - would do the same as webResourceManager is expected to do

2. #requireResourceIfPresent("some.module:key") - same as #requireResource, but if it can't be added, don't issue a warning

3. Not strictly for the gadgets, but if a <web-resource> module in atlassian-plugin.xml could depend on all resources in a context, such as:
{code:xml}
<web-resource key="my-resource">
  <dependency>normal.module:dependency</dependency>
  <dependency context="some.context"/> <!-- depends on all resources for the context -->
</web-resource>
{code}


All of these is needed to correctly include resources for the Structure plugin, because it needs them to, say, have inline edit of custom fields, which can be provided by other plugins and the editors might require additional web resources.
fields.summary: Better resource dependency controls in the gadget XML

fields.description:
Reproduction Sequence:
0. Have Quick Create/Edit turned on (by default)
1. Create a dashboard with a gadget that displays a table of issues, say, "Assgned to Me".
2. Use "gear" action dropdown on a non-subtask issue and select action "Create Sub-Task"

Observed: a new pop-up dialog with Create Sub-task form -- however, the Issue Type: field lists all non-subtask issue types. 

Expected: sub-task issue types in the selection field.

One can proceed with creation of an issue, but it won't be a sub-task, but a regular issue - according to the selected issue type.

From what I can see, the problem is that parentIssueId is correctly extracted from the iframe context and not passed to the server.

/The same problem happens in the Structure plugin, so I hope one fix will cover it all./
fields.summary: "Create Sub-Task" does not show sub-task issue types when called from a gadget's drop-down menu, when Quick Create is enabled
Unable to retrieve watchers via REST / Watchers not copied correctly when cloning an issue
Log on version release date
The script used by Active Objects in JIRA to generate index should be in uppercase
Chart/graph for daily changes in issue numbers
Please update Flowdock plugin to 1.50.5 on JOD

fields.description:
WSDL file jirasoapservice-v2.wsdl contain some error in our point of view:

1. in the description of the type specified, that he must return the element ID, but returns the attribute ID:

now is:
{noformat}
<complexType abstract="true" name="AbstractRemoteEntity">
 <sequence>
  <element name="id" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
 </sequence>
</complexType>
{noformat}

in our point of view must be:
{noformat}
<complexType abstract="true" name="AbstractRemoteEntity">
 <attribute  name="id" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
</complexType>
{noformat}

2. in the description of the type missing some element:

{noformat}
<complexType name="RemoteIssue">
<complexContent>
<extension base="tns1:AbstractRemoteEntity">
<sequence>
....
<element name="id" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
....
</sequence>
</extension>
</complexContent>
</complexType>
{noformat}
fields.summary: REST jira api missing some element in description
Document the fact that javascript added to the field configuration scheme overrides that added to the fields description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28009].
  {panel}

When writing emails to people, it's really nice to alt+Printscreen something, then paste it into the mail.

Rather than having to use windows snippets or MSPaint to paste the file, save it somewhere, then browse to that location (whether from the attachments browse... or by finding it via windows, then using Jira's drag/drop.

just... Paste!  would be so much nicer.  perhaps you guys have a little box that you click, then "paste" so that it's going into an "aware" part of the create form.

Would be awesome, increase usability of JIRA and save us time!
fields.summary: Gmail style clipboard paste in the create issue pane

fields.summary: project in (ACNET, ALLX, ALNU, ACNTW, ACVW) AND status CHANGED FROM "Resolved" TO "Validated" query doesn't work

fields.description:
In JIRA 4.4, the Jelly subtag {{jira:AddCustomFieldValue}} is not working as documented.

The code below use to work on previous versions of JIRA:

{code:xml}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
    <jira:CreateIssue project-key="ABC" summary="Issue summary" reporter="testuser">
        <jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_12345" value="Option 1"/>
    </jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

If I specify the 'Option 1' id of 10001 it works:

{code:xml}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
    <jira:CreateIssue project-key="ABC" summary="Issue summary" reporter="Tim Fox">
        <jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_12345" value="10001"/>
    </jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

However, the documentation on Jelly tags hasn't changed from previous versions to JIRA 4.4. Please update the following documentation to reflect this behavior:

[Jelly Tags|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Jelly+Tags]
fields.summary: Improve the documentation on Jelly tags for JIRA 4.4
Importing a project/CSV is failing due to a Custom Field restricted to Issue Types
Icon at transition button

fields.description: We added a workflow validator that ensures that a certain custom field is given a value whenever an issue is created. However we had already created a number of issues prior to adding the validator, and some of those issues did not have a value in that field. When we try to clone one of those issues the workflow validator prevents the clone from being created (which is to be expected). However no error is reported on the screen and the cloner link is created from the original issue back to itself. Also, if the issue had sub-tasks then we end up with a sub-task link from the parent to itself which we cannot remove !
fields.summary: No error report and erroneous actions when unable to create clone issue

fields.description:
Behaviour:
When the user creates a custom field (Text Field) with really long name, example:

{code}
Loooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnngggggggggggggg oooooooooooooooooooooooonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnggggggggggggggggggg custom field.
{code}

it will merge together with the value of that custom field in the "View Issue" Screen. Replicated on 4.4.4 but there was no issue with it. Replicated on 5.0.2 specifically and the problem occurs.

Steps to replicate:
1. Create a very long custom field name
* type: text field
* ie: Loooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnngggggggggggggg oooooooooooooooooooooooonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnggggggggggggggggggg custom field.
2. Associate with a screen (Default, Resolve Issue, or Workflow)
3. Try to create an issue and insert a value into the custom field
4. View the issue to see the behaviour

Kindly view the screenshot for further explanation.
fields.summary: Custom Field name merges with its value

See attach.
fields.summary: Local Jira site's start page doen't open in Google Chrome 18

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28000].
  {panel}

It would be nice, when taking an outage, to be able to push an announcement to users - regardless of where they are in the application - that shows both a countdown as well as a message related to an outage. For example: 

An outage will be taken on the system in 5:00 minutes. The outage is expected to last for 30:00 minutes. During this time, you will not have access to the system. Please wrap up your current activities. If you have questions or concerns regarding this outage, please contact a JIRA Administrator. 

The 5:00 minutes in this example would countdown. 
JIRA Administrator would be linked to the default JIRA Administrators contact page. 
The two times would be configurable by the Admin.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin, I can start a countdown viewable by users when taking a system outage so that users know to wrap up their activities before they lose access.
